page.title: 07EDINBANE - HIDDEN AMENITIES
page.content: There is no church in Edinbane, but in the next township there are three churches drawing congregations from townships on either side. Other amenities are mobile. There are three banks calling once or twice a week and they carry out all routine transactions. The mobile grocer, butcher and fishmonger shops are very useful for older people and for people with no car. The shops come at the same time every week. Coal merchants call every fortnight with coal, anthracite or furnacite. Every second Tuesday the mobile library calls with books for adults and little children. Schoolchildren have three deliveries of library books to school each year. A mobile drapery shop calls several times a year. Among many other items, they sell Portree High School Uniforms.
